events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred at the intersection downtown, causing significant damage to the vehicle's front bumper and headlights.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the involvement of the insured vehicle in a collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer throughout the claims process and gather all pertinent details.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim, assuring the customer that the investigation would begin promptly.
The agent requested additional documents including vehicle photos, police report, and repair estimates to support the claim evaluation.
The customer submitted all requested documents, including detailed repair quotes and the official police accident report.
An investigation team began assessing the claim to verify damages and liability based on the submitted evidence and reports.
The investigation concluded with confirmation of vehicle damage consistent with the reported collision and no contributory negligence from the insured.
The insurer proposed a settlement offer covering the full cost of repairs as per the repair estimates provided earlier.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the promptness and fairness of the settlement offer and confirmed acceptance.
The claim was officially approved by the insurance team after customer agreement on the proposed settlement terms.
Payment was issued to the customerâ€™s repair shop to cover all validated costs related to the vehicle accident damages.
With all payments processed and customer confirmation received, the claim was formally closed as resolved and complete.
The case files and documentation related to this auto accident claim were securely archived for future reference and compliance.
